citeinfo.title: Particulate Matter (PM-10) NAAQS Designations, Region 9, 2014, US EPA Region 9

descript.abstract: Polygon feature class of nonattainment areas for particulate matter
descript.purpose: This data set is specifically designed for use with ArcGIS and related software. Data may be used for reference to boundaries of attainment areas in Region 9.
descript.supplinf: Washoe Planning area (Truckee Meadows) redesignated to attainment, effective January 7, 2016. More information available at https://federalregister.gov/a/2015-30487.

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.
idinfo.datacred: Acknowledgement of US EPA Region 9 AIR Division.

attracc.attraccr: The spatial data is based on Public Land Survey System (PLSS), and political boundaries such as urban, county, state and tribal boundaries, thus the line work reflects the source; for example, PLSS or county.

dataqual.logic: The spatial data is based on the Code of Federal Regulations - Protection of Environment, PARTS 81 TO 99, current as of September 29, 2010.
dataqual.complete: The line work is completed, and will be updated per EPA's designations process.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal Accuracy is based on the Public Land Survey System (BLM)

procstep.procdesc: Metadata imported and updated after review.
West Pinal nonattainment area merged to existing SHP file.
Tohono O'odham tribal land boundary (San Lucy Farms) updated per ADEQ's request; metadata updated.
South Coast/Coachella boundaries adjusted to reflect 68 FR 57820 (October 7, 2003)
South Coast redignated to Attainment (Maintenace) per 78 FR 38223
Sacramento County, CA redesignated to attainment (Maintenance area) per 78 FR 59261

enttyp.enttypd: Designated Areas for Particulate Matter PM-10 in Region 9

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Attainment/Nonattainment assignment to an area per national ambient air quality standards

edom.edomvd: Area meeting the standard or expected to be meeting the standard despite a lack of monitoring data

attr.attrdef: Level of severity in a designated area

edom.edomvd: Initial nonattainment classification assigned to an area. For a Moderate Area, the attainment date shall be as expeditiously as practicable but no later than the end of the sixth calendar year after the areaâ??s designation as nonattainment, except that, for areas designated nonattainment for PMâ??10 under section 7407 (d)(4) of this title, the attainment date shall not extend beyond December 31, 1994. Title 42 of the U.S. Code, Chapter 85, Subchapter 1, Part D, subpart 4, Â§7513.

Any area that the Administrator determines cannot practicably attain the national ambient air quality standard for PMâ??10 by the attainment date (as prescribed in subsection (c) of this section) for Moderate Areas. For a Serious Area, the attainment date shall be as expeditiously as practicable but no later than the end of the tenth calendar year beginning after the areaâ??s designation as nonattainment, except that, for areas designated nonattainment for PMâ??10 under section 7407 (d)(4) of this title, the date shall not extend beyond December 31, 2001. Title 42 of the U.S. Code, Chapter 85, Subchapter 1, Part D, subpart 4, Â§7513.

Area that was formerly violating but is now attaining the standard. Each State which submits a request under section 7407 (d) of this title for redesignation of a nonattainment area for any air pollutant as an area which has attained the national primary ambient air quality standard for that air pollutant shall also submit a revision of the applicable State implementation plan to provide for the maintenance of the national primary ambient air quality standard for such air pollutant in the area concerned for at least 10 years after the redesignation. The plan shall contain such additional measures, if any, as may be necessary to ensure such maintenance. Title 42 of the U.S. Code, Chapter 85, Subchapter 1, Part D, subpart 1, Â§7505a.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Effective date: date at which the designated area's status begins applying to the state implementing a state implementation plan (SIP), which is designed to help the state attain the NAAQS.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Hyperlink or universal resource locator (URL) which points to a description of a designated area's boundary.

attrdomv.udom: Universal resource locator (URL) or internet address

overview.eaover: Nonattainment area designations and classifications, as defined in the Code of Federal Regulations, part 81. More information is available at the Clean Air Act website, at http://www.epa.gov/air/caa/title1.html.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

idCitation.resTitle: NAAQS Designated Area Polygons - Particulate Matter (PM-10), Region 9, 2014, US EPA Region 9

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Polygon feature class of nonattainment areas for particulate matter < 10 microns. Nonattainment areas are geographic areas which have not met national ambient air quality standards (NAAQS) for articulate matter air pollution. These standards are part of the Clean Air Act. See Code of Federal Regulations, Section 40 Part 81, for detailed information about Ambient Air Quality Standards. More detailed information about NAAQS can be found on the following web page: http://www.epa.gov/ttn/naaqs/
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This data set is specifically designed for use with ArcGIS and related software. Data may be used for reference to boundaries of attainment areas in Region 9.

Consts.useLimit: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: Washoe Planning area (Truckee Meadows) redesignated to attainment, effective January 7, 2016. More information available at https://federalregister.gov/a/2015-30487.

report.measDesc: The spatial data is based on the Code of Federal Regulations - Protection of Environment, PARTS 81 TO 99, current as of September 29, 2010.
The line work is completed, and will be updated per EPA's designations process.

The spatial data is based on Public Land Survey System (PLSS), and political boundaries such as urban, county, state and tribal boundaries, thus the line work reflects the source; for example, PLSS or county.
Horizontal Accuracy is based on the Public Land Survey System (BLM)
